text:
hi Everyone,
when we create a login portal for membership, we can use the HubSpot Website/private Content/ to setup the login, register, forgot password, reset password.
The url will be access once setup
• `<your domain>/_hcms/mem/login`
• `<your domain>/_hcms/mem/logout`
Can we create another login portal for admin and give a url as
• `<your domain>/_hcms/admin/login`
• `<your domain>/_hcms/admin/logout`
no. what you might want to do is. create a user type, and then in your pages you can set up content for those user types

Thank you nicholas. Yes based on user type I can redirect the content. But login page layout and url will be same right?
I want different front end layout for admin login and member login.

url will be the same no way around that at the moment. 

if you wanted to do this you could be a bit hacky and store some local storage variables for those people. you’d need to test a bit but if the local storage variable is there you could add a class name to something and try to style it differently. 

i’m not sure if any css files are loaded that way or if is files are loaded. but if you are looking to hack your way about that would be the way i would attempt it
good luck. if you don’t mind responding to this when you give a try. i’m about 2 weeks i may do this
